sections.title: Overview
sections.content: The log conformance provides structured logging for all Hologram components. It ensures consistent, parseable, and queryable log output across the entire system.

sections.title: Log Levels
sections.content: Log levels in order of severity: trace (most verbose), debug (debugging info), info (general information), warn (warning conditions), error (error conditions), fatal (critical errors that cause termination).

sections.title: Structured Format
sections.content: Logs are output in JSON format with required fields (timestamp, level, namespace, message) and optional context fields (correlation_id, trace_id, etc.). This enables efficient parsing and querying.

sections.title: Context Propagation
sections.content: Correlation IDs and trace IDs are propagated through the call chain, enabling distributed tracing and debugging across multiple components.

sections.title: Performance
sections.content: Async logging with buffering minimizes performance impact. Logs are buffered and flushed periodically or when the buffer is full.

sections.title: Filtering and Sampling
sections.content: Logs can be filtered by level or pattern, and sampled to reduce volume in high-traffic scenarios while maintaining visibility.
